intro: Axinaea lawessonii, commonly known as the Philippine wax tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and dense foliage. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
